name: language-image
readme:
# Image link colorization in Atom

[![Atom Package](https://img.shields.io/apm/v/language-image.svg)](https://atom.io/packages/language-image)
[![Atom Package Downloads](https://img.shields.io/apm/dm/language-image.svg)](https://atom.io/packages/language-image)
[![Wercker](https://img.shields.io/wercker/ci/wercker/docs.svg?maxAge=2592000)](https://github.com/thtliife/language-image)
[![GitHub issues](https://img.shields.io/github/issues/thtliife/language-image.svg)](https://github.com/thtliife/language-image/issues)
[![GitHub license](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-MIT-blue.svg)](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/thtliife/language-image/master/LICENSE.md)
[![js-standard-style](https://img.shields.io/badge/code%20style-standard-brightgreen.svg)](http://standardjs.com/)
[![Twitter](https://img.shields.io/twitter/url/https/github.com/thtliife/language-image.svg?style=social)](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Check out @thtliife%27s language-image package, for %23githubs awesome %23atom text editor!:&url=https%3A%2F%2Fatom.io%2Fpackages%2Flanguage-image)

Adds syntax highlighting to image links embedded in strings, comments, and plain
text in Atom.

## Installation

Using apm:

```bash
apm install language-image
```

Or search for `language-image` in Atom settings view

## Built With

*   [Atom](https://atom.io)
